tCQOksLR6GF1BPx-t6h8BQ.text: I absolutely love the pancakes here.  I have tried several other places in the area and still come back here for the best Pancakes!  My favs are the PB pancakes and the Honey French toast!  Soooo good!  I haven't had the crepes yet but plan to try those next time I'm in.

PiuhfuVUIj-Ym27SbsRZ_Q.text: I have eaten here a number of times. Each time I have ordered a different meal to try out their range of meals. I have had sandwiches, breakfasts and always had the same results - AWESOME food.   First let me say the garlic rice is to die for....or kill Dracula. The garlic can be easily smelled and the taste clear...and I LOVE it! Always worth getting.  The short ribs are very flavorful and well worth the price.  The club sandwich was a perfect blend of ingredients that left you full & completely satisfied.  The breakfast burritos are HUGE and entice your taste buds. Not a big breakfast burrito/omelet fan but you change your mind quickly as it passes by you. Hmmmm what's that?  The service is quick, thorough, and friendly. I have always had excellent service here.  The only downside is that it does get busy. Expected since the food is so good and reasonably priced.

tPBJpWS82YVqk2iY6aQngw.text: Happy they opened a Babystacks on my side Of town. You have to try everything. It's all good. Been to both the flamingo and blue diamond restaurant and everything taste the same with great people. This is a smaller restaurant so there will be a wait, but worth the wait. They have a variety of pancakes and variety of food in general. Great people and awesome customer service.

xbOfUfHDVWEu5Z1GeNSfpQ.text: We enjoyed a nice brunch here the last time we were in town. Located in a busy shopping plaza, Babystacks is good for breakfast and lunch options. I came here mainly at the suggestion of fluffy pancakes by friends who frequent it. I like that they have Hawaiian & traditional American breakfast items.  I went with the spam scramble and a babystack of chocolate chip pancakes. The spam scramble was ok. It came with a scoop of furikake rice and a decent amount of cubed spam and scrambled eggs. I prefer my spam a little more toasty but other than that, this dish is not bad.   The pancakes... Oh so good. Im glad I picked the chocolate chip. It was a great topping along with the whipped cream & powdered sugar. The pancakes were soft and fluffy. I really enjoyed them. It came with a chocolate sauce but I didnt even use it. The pancakes didnt need them. They were tasty as is. The portion was also just right.   Service was good. We had 3 different people asking us for our drink orders after someone already took it. Ha!.. Babystacks is busy. Pay up at the register when you get your bill. They close by mid-afternoon. FYI.

Tl77OJqiMqvuN2XrwT5iFg.text: I stopped to get breakfast before returning to the hospital where my husband was waiting.  I ordered a take out order so I could get back. Scrambled eggs with sausage links, home fries, buttermilk pancakes and a side of carnitas.  The eggs were so runny they got the undercooked home fries soggy and gross. One little pat of butter and dry carnitas pretty much ruined Mother's Day breakfast.  When I finally got home about 6 hours later, I had to cook everything to get it at least edible.  Very gross, I don't recommend ordering eggs or home fries for takeout.

LPjo74OcPyYFwsD8SStKng.text: Pancakes were delicious but the hashbrowns were flat. Salt and pepper people, salt and pepper.   I was informed after the fact that this place was known for Hawaiian/Filipino cuisine and will definitely try some on my next trip out.

waKPRYxV5ylyWy-a3FZ8Eg.text: My fiance loves coming here for the pancakes. They offer a wide variety of specialty pancakes that can't be found at other breakfast places. I definitely recommend this place if you want to try some unique pancakes. I love coming here for the cookie butter toast which has nutella with pie crust! I haven't been able to find a toast quite like it anywhere else.

5k7cCuSQCKnCJM-yXSdVGA.text: Very good food and service.   This is a small place so plan accordingly for big groups. We were a group of 6; 4 adults, 2 kids, and 1 baby in a stroller. We were accommodated in less than 15 minutes, stroller and all. I had the adobo ride and chicken omelette, my husband had the cowboy omelette, and we split a stack of carrot cake pancakes. Everything tasted good and the service was great despite the restaurant being pretty full. Overall this was a good place to have breakfast and we'd love to return on our next trip to Las Vegas.

YQqTeFi5V10BUffw7Jls4Q.text: Hawaiian breakfast food in Vegas!! Owners are from Hawaii, so they have protugese sausage, spam, kalua pig just to name a few. Crowded on the weekends but wait won't be longer than 10 mins. The service is just like back home on the islands and the food is even better than the service. If you're missing the islands, this is a must stop!

hnDOhC8QzPxKo3VZykhR6g.text: It was good.  I ordered the banana cream pancakes and eggs and potatoes.  It was good, I wish the place had booths but sometimes a harder chair is better for my back, it just depends.  I didnt really see what the hype was all about though, I have heard so much about the place that I expected something amazing and to me it was just a place to have breakfast.     we will be back though.

igi4ZRP5j97ZA8xbolb1Ig.text: Definitely one of my favourite breakfast and lunch places! The adobo fried rice is my go to and I get it 99% of the time. I do love the garlic rice, lemon ricotta pancakes (and I usually don't like pancakes but theirs rocks) and their Benedict's are delicious too!

fc7Ge_UMlxz8mnZHDg3PYA.text: I need to preface this with I don't like breakfast. I never eat breakfast.  Somehow, some friends convinced me to go eat here with them. I had the loco moco with garlic rice. I had dreams about this garlic rice.... like, why am I not eating it right now?   This place is basically a Hawaiian food / American diner breakfast place. I think I'll try to postmates my meal next time. Overall, if you're in to breakfast, or want some good Hawaiian food the morning after some heavy drinking, this is a great place to go.

8CdcayoQkSieGw3FJq89uA.text: This place has pretty good food, sad their service is completely awful! First, a party of two has to wait to be seated after every party of 4 or 6 because the host doesn't want them to wait too long if she gives up too many 2 seats, they wait to push tables together to accommodate the parties that come after. So a wait time for a party of 2 is ridiculous when it should be vice versa. They messed up the order and was short with us when we asked to fix it. So sad, but when they always have a line no one will do anything about it.

niLxUIyHqBJ46GRFXQx1_A.text: I went here on grand opening day on June 10, 2016 and had a great experience! Surprisingly, there was not a long wait and we got amazing service. The menu is not different from the other locations, and that's understandable, why change a good thing?  I tried the creamsicle pancakes this time and they were so good! They are my second favorite, after the red velvet pancakes. My husband had the Mexican skillet and it was very good. It wasn't much different from other restaurants, I'm sure, but it was classically good.   Anyway, I'm so glad this is close to home! I can't wait to come back!

mpeSqJGB3515kr9P_-C-ng.text: Merry Grand Opening BabyStacks Cafe!  Where:  In the Southwest on Blue Diamond between Buffalo and Cimarron. The restaurant is more spacious than the Flamingo/Buffalo location.   Food:  We had our "usual" order of the Spam Scramble with garlic fried rice, corned beef and eggs with hash browns, rocky road and banana cream pancakes.  We've had this same exact order at two other locations and there was no hiccup in quality despite it being their Grand Opening. In fact everything was up to the high quality standards I've come to expect from BabyStacks. The food was delicious and cooked perfectly.   Service:  Was great and everything ran smoothly. Drinks never empty. I appreciate that we didn't have to wait long. 5-10 min till we were seated, which is great compared to some other wait times experienced at other locations.

KOQud-ObV2fQBDjVPwYpdQ.text: I am so glad this opened up by my house!! This place rocks. Red velvet and German chocolate are my favorite pancakes! The staff has always been friendly and attentive. wO3f5k_QaV7jDTNWWcksEQ.text: This is our favorite breakfast. Usually have to wait for a table. Totally worth it. My kids insisted on waiting even when it was a 45 min. wait.

They are only open until 2 Monday thru Friday and we didn't know they closed while we were eating but they were still really nice about. I will be back many more times

7rxolxY-7_ovMCD4UG62hw.text: My family loves babystacks.  It's our first time going to the location on Bluediamond...  We got our usual loco moco dish with garlic fried rice.  However, this time our garlic rice was more like onion rice. They roughly diced huuuuge pieces of onion and there were so many pieces in  the rice I had to pick out all that I could out.  Huge chopped raw onion in the garlic rice killed the experience for us. Not sure why it was in the rice this time but it was not good.  From a cook family to another, I'm sorry but I don't think we will be coming back for that. Which sucks because this location is closer to home. We asked for extra gravy twice, our server forgot. We went early so it wasn't busy. We asked for a different drink and they forgot that until the food came out as well.  No one came to refill my water either. I don't like to complain but those are basic restaurant services.  :)

-aizDGFnoAI0kYHt9hLmyQ.text: I love going to this restaurant, but today it was very disappointing for them to tell their customer that there will be 10-20 minute wait but the dinning area is half empty. First family that's waiting without being greeted, left frustrated and then we follow after being inform that there's an additional 10-20 wait. Maybe we walked in with them being short staff, but we left this place and went straight to Metro Dinner..again this review has nothing to do with the food, never had an issue with the quality of food here always very good.

bG5nbOCYmJMBgby4nkgcGQ.text: Delicious food, not so good service from the greeter girls. One in particular had attitude, no smile, when apologizing for the wait (even though there were open tables!) she didn't seem to care.  But the food I ordered- adobo fried rice and banana foster pancakes were so delicious it ALMOST had me forget about her terrible service, almost.

bBAolvaGjDal-ir4iHw2XQ.text: This is a frequent go to for weekend breakfast/brunch.  They have such a wide variety of pancakes and Hawaiian staples.  I often get the Portuguese sausage egg sliders on Hawaiian rolls.  But it is also hard to pass on their crepes or red velvet pancakes.

QTeQSTa835AgGzKsefKcIg.text: Love Babystacks variety of the pancakes and it's now across the street from my house....The place is small but the wait usually isn't to long...Also the strawberry lemonade is delicious

al6Zy45K7JlhS7tPa_AD2Q.text: Had red velvet pancakes.  They are of high dessert quality.  Great.  Everything is served in good portion size. You'll probably need a box.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes short stack.

ZopeNMM3cXvCeFEc3Ee-Ag.text: We never get to go here on the weekends because the wait is always at least an hour. I just had a new baby so my husband took a week off to spend with us, so we were able to go during the week and get a table right away. I got red velvet pancakes which are always my fav here, and furikake and spam garlic rice. Service is always great and gives you that ohana feeling, plus the Hawaiian reggae music totally sets the mood. I wish we could eat here more, the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I wish all of their locations would either add additional seating or expand so there isn't such a long wait during peak times. Even adding some tables outside could help. Put that in the suggestion box haha and thanks for the ono breakfast!

SHEW8gYZXfBxg0rcYt7Cdw.text: Came in on a Saturday around 1pm. The place was busy but we were seated immediately.   I usually get the red velvet pancakes but this time I changed it up and got the Cookie Butter French Toast. Seriously it was AMAZING. Cookie butter was sandwiched between 2 pieces of French Toast. Drizzled in Nutella with a little bit of syrup. It was perfect.   My husband got the BAE sandwich. Bacon, aioli and an over easy egg with a hamburger bun. Definitely a winner. It had a little bit of a kick to it, but just the right amount.   We'd definitely get both again.  Service was great as usual.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie Butter French Toast
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BAE (Bacon, Aioli, Egg)

dLFN3R_cWR3ZmZiO5YNMQw.text: Not much of a breakfast person but when I do get breakfast, this is the only spot that hits the spot! I always get the spam and eggs with garlic rice with a side of banana fosters pancakes. Yup, ya girl can eat!!   Staff is nice and very attentive. Place can get pretty busy, but worth the wait. I've ventured from my usual order and have tried the German chocolate pancakes, but didn't like it as much.   I'll always find my way back to baby stacks even when I'm trying to diet.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana fosters pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam and eggs with garlic rice

Jx5XmZ8OHeP3y1dGuFN0hw.text: First of all! Babystacks is amazing and I actually dream about their island omelette. That being said, this place is our go-to breakfast spot everytime we're in Vegas. From the AMAZING and consistent service to the phenomenal array of breakfast goodies, I can't get enough of this restaurant.  Food - Okay, I don't eat many refined carbs but I snuck a bite of their basic buttermilk pancakes and WOW!!!!!! These were packed with delicious flavor. Totally worth the sugar spike!They have all kinds of dessert and flavored pancakes but I usually get the island omelette or basic eggs and bacon. Yes, the island omelette is for the brave I mean, who puts gravy on an omelette?! But, the gravy works perfectly! You also can't go wrong with their Kahlua pork or their huge bacon slices.  Service - Fast and friendly service really makes this place a joy to visit. I have been here many times and have never had a problem getting a table. It also helps that you pay at the front. Don't forget to tip your waitress or waiter.They're working really hard!  Ambiance - Very basic! Sometimes can be a little cramped but I keep coming back so it doesn't bother me that much. There is plenty of seating and it's great for large groups and kids that might get messy!  Try this restaurant, you won't be sorry!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Omelette

WM8HTes5c0eys9DOMguW8Q.text: Mood- breakfast  Upon entering was greeted with upbeat customer service and ushered over to a table.  It wasn't busy during the time I went in. After looking at all the delights on the menu, opted for kalbi beef, Huntington skillet, and given a bananas foster as a substitute. I was in awe by the pancakes and those ribs. The flavor was on point.   Interior was clean with many tables. They definitely started getting busy as the time progressed. Hours open was 7am - this was very refreshing.  Would recommend- pricing is reasonable  Location Blue Diamond/ Durango- ample parking

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sour dough toast
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalibi beef, eggs,  upgraded garlic rice

97IVttIUeukwYsPqyUg99A.text: I heard great things about this place from my cousins.  They said they offer Filipino food so I was super stoked to try them out. Came here for breakfast on a Monday. Not busy and got seated fairly quickly. We were a big group. 18 people to be exact! Luckily we came on a weekday because this place was not big.   I had coffee and the Kalua Pig Benedict. Oh my goodness. The Benedict was delish! The meat was not salty, the egg was poached right and the bread ended up not being too soggy from the egg and meat. I also had country potatoes as the side. I finished the entire plate. Really enjoyed it!   Our waiter was patient with us considering the size of our group and that half of us were under the age of 10. Kudos to him! I'm sure it wasn't easy. I definitely recommend this place for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua Pork Eggs Benedict

RVYNhvGe3GAMH_mWeMbgOQ.text: My go to spot for breakfast after the gym!   I'm going to keep this short and tell you exactly what to order:   KALBI RIBS WITH GARLIC RICE   Period.

WLavSFYPryW3uDRoFtqlXw.text: Hubby, Mike and I met here at 9am for a weekend breakfast.  It being a Saturday would explain the packed house. We had no worries and had to wait about 10 minutes.  The staff was busy, our server friendly, the ambiance open and a little noisy. Hubby ordered the HM1 skillet, I ordered the bacon/eggs/pancake combo, our friend ordered the sausage/eggs/hash browns combo. The timing of receiving our meals was about right for a very busy establishment, the food look and tasted good.  I was amazed at the choices of types of pancake plates one could order!  Looks like I will have to come back again and again to order them one at a time. I say this is definite place to try out when in the Southwest part of Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon/eggs/pancakes combo, HM1 skillet, sausage/eggs/toast combo
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CeveKV00TiXkm2R7t4p9TQ.text: Just a bunch of Hawai'i locals looking for some food to make us feel like at home!   My mom has been living in Nevada for over a year now & she misses all the local food sadly in Reno they do not offer much for Hawai'i locals so I knew I had to take her here!   This was the second trial of getting to eat here, we tried on the weekend & it was Busy. Came back on a weekday & it was great! No wait at all. Hostess & servers were very sweet.   The Portuguese sausage was the talk of town on our table. My mom wanted to know where to get it so she could get a bunch to bring back to Reno. The adobo fried rice was delicious! Not salty at all. The pancakes were delicious & my boyfriend enjoyed his crepe. We will be back here the next time we visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Portuguese sausage

DUcTIrgb1trl6Fry-Umccg.text: We flew in to Vegas Sunday morning and my besties picked us up and headed straight here. They come here with their young daughters, who had lots of good things to say too. Holy moly, it did not disappoint at all!  First of all, I didn't know where to start. I love breakfast food, but I am always conflicted on ordering sweet versus savory. I tend to go with savory, however... I am on vacation and we got it all. I am Filipino and was thrilled that there were rice options. Both my daughter and I ordered rice (adobo fried rice wrapped in egg omelette for my teen daughter, corned beef hash w/ rice for me) My friends ordered a stack red velvet pancakes for the table so we can all have some... oh my, it tasted like red velvet cake. Everything was good... the buttermilk pancakes were probably the best I've ever had.  Portions are excellent. Service is good. Friendly, helpful servers. It was about a 30-40 minute wait for us around 10AM on a Sunday, so be aware. We were busy catching up, so time went by for us. Not good if you are hungry! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rd9SDuKIWaBvPq5U7xVkUw.text: I didn't know about this spot until my friends and family in Vegas told me about it. I just had to go and try their famous red velvet pancakes! The place itself from this establishment was a little small, but it was very busy and organized, that traffic was going both in and out. I got their famous Adobo fried rice wrapped in egg and upgraded my side to the red velvet pancakes! I had an extra order of the Baby chick omelette with a side of the regular buttermilk pancakes and potatoes. I just have to say the food that I ordered were definitely must-haves here!  The Adobo fried rice was really good with the egg wrapped around it. I had a full meal just wrapped in egg! The shredded meat inside (unsure if it was chicken or pork) was juicy and delicious! The Baby chick omelette was so fluffy. If you love mushrooms like I do, this one is the omelette to get.   The pancakes. The regular pancakes AND the red velvet pancakes did taste the same, but they still tasted good. The red velvet seemed to just be the regular pancakes with red food coloring with different add-ons with the cream cheese and whipped cream, but I can see why it was their best seller. It's till great to get, especially for kids!   I was so full form this spot from my first visit, that I know I have to go back and try the other flavors for the pancakes and dishes!

5m6wwurJKe0uDwssZv3Xhw.text: Giving this place another try. I tried everyone's food as I always do and everyone's dish was pretty good. My burger patty was pretty good. However, the pancakes tasted more like baking soda and the chili moco was good but my husband thought it was just chili and didn't like that there was a patty underneath.  The girl that served us was pretty great!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi and eggs
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger

vKaiNsvL9aE_TMIn29laaQ.text: This is my favorite place to bring my out of town guests and they always love it . They have so many different options for pancakes. I have yet to try one I do not like .  My favorite are the s'mores pancakes but the red velvet are their specialty. Even if you're not a pancake person the regular menu is huge .The Mexican skillet is also one of my faves . It comes with a side of pancakes so you can have the best of both worlds .  The portion sizes are pretty big so I always share with someone .   This place has never let me down . The food and the service is great . This location is pretty small . I find it best to come on a week day or around opening time .   Every time I come here the experience is 5 stars all around .

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican skillet
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet pancakes

lTQl9paPKjISxJmatYo92w.text: Babystacks is the another pancake place I've been going to recently. Craving those cakes lately. These are small, light and fluffy. So simple a dish, but they do it so well. Tried the strawberry  with strawberry sauce as well as the red velvet with white chocolate sauce on my second trip. Came back Again to try the bacon pancakes and more!!! Looks like Vegas has me covered for those delicious pancakes.

ve2oJ9_YKuIpyk2K1bs6IQ.text: Love this breakfast/brunch/lunch spot! They have the best food! I didn't know they opened one on Blue diamond but I am so happy they did! Although I would drive 35 minutes to go to the other location on the northwest side of town. I had the huevos ranchos - this was the first time I had ordered this and it blew me away! It was delicious beyond words! We also ordered the Huntington omelet which was so fresh! The red velvet pancakes is a must order here - if you haven't tried them then you are surely not living !!!!!! So happy my favorite spot is so close !

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington omelette
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes

9Ni1g1pCkNBQXSIhwC5tTQ.text: Cute spot with an island vibe. Food was flavorful and arrived quickly.  Luckily we didn't have to wait long for a seat, but there was plenty of room for large parties.

TeIN_PwUlqjhqiLbrFkERQ.text: Walk in and feel like I'm back in Hawaii. On a busy day the wait could make you stand outside but other than that it shouldn't be too long. The customer service is nice and friendly. Food is always good. I usually get the adobo fried rice and upgrade my pancakes to the red velvet. Hawaiian music is always on and sports is on the tv. My type of place. Highly recommend.

_M3VJlP3BqqgCMw2PMp_Aw.text: Hog Heaven!! Literally. That shredded pork moco loco is bomb diggity. Banana cream pancakes, Portuguese sausage, hash browns and that omelette stuffed with that pork and rice, Cloud9!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a9NmAOa0QNux7iEoiAaang.text: Our first visit Today and all I can say is WOW! Pancakes are out of this world. They have many different varieties and all very good not too sweet. We order adobo fried rice omelet and skillets all great portions and tasty. Service was excellent and our food came so fast. We came early and when we left there was a lot of people waiting. We will definitely come back!

DCNMHbe0LLN7ydmg6KoXFw.text: The red velvet pancakes are delisheeoso! The sweet cream dipping sauce that comes with it is magic.  The ambiance is so so but the food makes it up for it.  I'm still a firm believer in ambiance though.  Kick it up a notch.  I also ordered lolo ricks adobo omelette.  That was really good but it was kind of dry.  Needed a little adobo sauce or something.   Anyhow been here twice since I moved to Vegas recently and will coming back for those red velvet pancakes.

G6AdSvmEXqGKbkkMAjVfsw.text: Enjoyed breakfast here for the first time with 2 others.  The huevos rancheros with verde salsa was GREAT!  The buttermilk pancakes were good.  The nutella crepes with strawberries were delicious.    The servers were attentive and efficient.  This was the outstanding part that I remember from our time at this location.   The hostess handled the crowds and table/counter seating very well.   The only issue is that I almost waited just as long to pay the cashier as we did to get in for breakfast.  It's important that  the cashier knows the menu and can make recommendations; it's another thing to be "chatting" with one client while a line forms.    Overall, I think that we'll be back to try other items!

8YO4sK-mB6yVffL9rlbc2g.text: We came here for breakfast and when we walked in the lady asked how many people and we said two so she said it will be five min wait so we waited no problem then a group of 4 people walked in another lady said how many and then seated them so we were like oh maybe they had reservations or something oh didn't really think much of it THEN a couple walked in and the lady asked how many as usual then seated them right away WTF so apparently we never even existed lol so we just got up and walked out pretty terrible experience if you ask me we could have ate at another restaurant by this time. Will never go back.

zaN1C5-QnSouiNB_FLFHPw.text: We've been here before but decided not to come back again ever since my husband called in to order food to take home. When he went to pick up the food, the person at the register asked him how he would like to leave his tip, as in, "Will you be leaving a tip?" My husband was caught off guard and did not expect to feel pressured to leave a tip for ordering pancakes and picking them up to go. This is extremely tacky and rude of any business. We will never be coming back or taking family here again. We truly hope their staff learns proper etiquette.

1LpOixNbLheQ-NaMRLURuQ.text: came to babystacks because it offered so much variety! i had the white chocolate macadamia nut pancakes, but i regret not getting the corned beef burrito or the adobo fried rice. my friend had the steak (cooked perfectly) and my dad had the regular breakfast with a side of garlic rice, which i devoured because i LOVE garlic rice!  will definitely stop by and try more when i can!

dDPsnc3n-LZM7LTcEvGZTw.text: Second best thing about this place, number one being the food is Joey our waiter. He was so funny and not bad on the eyes plus he was a great waiter, kept our waters full and our food came out quickly. Side note, the water cups here are huge, like HUGE which I love because I drink my water like a fish.   I've been here a few times and always get the same thing, loco moco..because you can never go wrong with the loco moco, its delicious. But, today I felt a little adventurous and wanted to try something new. So, I tired the Hawaiian benedict. No regrets, the Hawaiian benne was bomb. Who would have thought Hawaiian bread an spam with gravy would have been so great. At the same time, I feel like spam with anything would make it great. Because Spam is great its "Sizzle Pork and MMM" cant go wrong with that slogan.  Also got the orange marmalade pancakes and my best friend got the banana nut pancakes. My goodness, both were sooooooooo gooood! I'm not a huge fan of pancakes, but I could eat those orange pancakes all day every day any time of the day.  Place was super clean and everyone staff member I came across was friendly and had a smile on their face. I will definitely become a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian benedict
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. orange marmalade

DPMmU0zV4Qw__fPEkw295A.text: I usually go to the Babystacks that's on Stephanie or the one around Flamingo. I had a good experience with both places. However, at this location it was not great as the other Babystacks. The service was alright. The seating and serving was quick. The problem was the cook. I believe whoever is in the kitchen isn't as great as the other locations. My boyfriend ordered Eggs Benedict and I got the Loco Moco. Both eggs were overcooked. I regret recommending this place to my boyfriend and he didn't even get to enjoy his meal. Aside from that, my meal was a bit off too. The meat was too overcooked and there was hardly any rice. It was a very disappointing breakfast. I even had the special Babystacks Pancakes to go and that order was wrong. I asked for cream cheese instead of syrup. Never bothered asking for a replacement because my bf and I just wanted to leave the place. Huge disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overcooked benedicts.

jR19ZPelXdd1JYfI0j7KNQ.text: On a road trip and spotted this place for breakfast.   We almost missed it but I am glad we didn't. The place was clean and the service was prompt and very friendly. Good coffee. Great food.  What a perfect start to the day.

mrTQqLswkvugrBzQPbGc1w.text: Excellent breakfast/brunch place.  Food is very good.  Love the large choice on pancakes.  Also love the breakfast potatoes.

9IA89r1xwxWLEkgqy5VCdA.text: Came in and asked how long the wait was for a party of 5 ( 3 adults & 2 babies) she said 30mins which was fine because I had to wait for my sisters. So when they arrived we waited pass the 30min time slot given and what was upsetting is that she had sat everyone else who had walked in after my whole party was there. I enjoy the food but the service has lacked through the years. Used to come here often but now only from time to time but probably changed to not coming back again. I love their red velvet pancakes but if I have to wait for a decade it's not worth it.

X2l1G6dLpOWfV18NrNn6PQ.text: Food was cold. Coffee was stale. There was a hair in my eggs. Just terrible. Won't be back.

sS8upEH0MbTt9c6YMdauUQ.text: Great breakfast food! I ordered the French toast combo with bacon and my friend ordered the cookie crust French toast I should of ordered that one instead she let me tried it and it was really good. This place is a great breakfast place I'm giving it four stars because the waiter took very long with our food.. we waited a while for our food to come. It was my first time coming to this place would definitely come back when I visit Las Vegas again.

kw9zccMJGfAv15tv7GkkIA.text: Always awesome food especially the pancakes! We never miss a time in Vegas that we won't eat at this restaurant.

fh4lSGJ47lkJGWXj6PJX_w.text: I love this place! So many different choices  I ordered their special pancakes of the month -tres leches... They were delicious, so fluffy. My boyfriend ordered the cookie and cream pancakes.. which basically tasted like chocolate cake! Definitely will be coming back whenever I'm in the mood for perfect pancakes!

u_wS_Yv3HykOMz3OcoijIg.text: Babystacks' 5th location!  They must be doing something right... Something.   Monkey do:    HUNTINGTON OMELET- bacon avocado cheddar & pico de gallo $9.5 PB & BANANA (2) $1.5 COFFEE $2  Sad omelet was eggs stuffed with bacon, cheese on top and slivers of avocado to decorate. Pico de gallo helped, but meh. Pancakes are dense and needed the huge water cup given. Peanut butter chips sweetened and provided most of flavor.  What a waste of time and money. Monkey make better at home and kick self for being lazy.   Smiley, friendly staff. Lovely decor. Packed on holiday weekend, very difficult to pay at register with podium corralling people waiting from dining area. Cashier had to walk from register to me to retrieve payment.  Annoying space.   Monkey been here, done that. It'll build a turd.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey do: PB &amp; ??? Banana! $1.5 with Omelet
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $10 Huntington Omelet look sad

nTayVT5n8l7yznTtQyMdTg.text: We've been to one of their locations before while visiting family. While googling places to go while in Vegas this time, we decided to come here again. They did not disappoint! I got their special - Lolo's Special Adobo Fried Rice Omelet. It was delicious!! I also loved their orange creamsicle pancakes!  We also got their Nutella crepes with bananas, build your own omelets and strawberry pancakes! Everything we had was so GOOD!!! Definitely a place we will come to visit every time we're in Vegas!

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange creamsicle pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry pancakes

CbYzixbpeMPMRRPk9qnd0w.text: Love this spot! Breakfast is always great and love the selection of pancakes. You know a place is great when it's always busy. Luckily I went in early and beat the morning rush. Definitely worth the wait though!

JHWK0NJjKe3l7ZdUQLUqmw.text: I just love Babystacks Cafe. The red velvet pancakes are to die for and my other favorite is the kahlua grilled cheese. Downside is they are incredibly busy on the weekends so be prepared to stand in line. Weekdays mornings are best.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mCj4UwdrbnoYONzgHoW81w.text: Blue Diamond Blvd, Las Vegas Location: Food and prices are decent. Great place to eat if you just want to eat and go. But not advisable if you want to eat and hangout a little. When me and my wife Ate there with a friend, we ordered one entree each and  a short stack of pancakes and drinks. After finishing our meals, we stayed and talked. As a lot of customers came in, we were asked to vacate. We found this VERY RUDE! This was our first time eating at this location...and DEFINITELY WILL BE OUR LAST!!!!

-odI-HSye9YE5KZYQ75DqA.text: Been coming here for at least half a year to this particular location & I love how we are recognized by certain staff members. Janet & Joey. They're both our favorites ! & were lucky to have them as our servers when they're there. Janet has always been so nice since we first had her as our server and has always remembered us since the first time. & joey is awesome ! He even remembers our orders Everytime !  Love coming here for breakfast.

eZWlbCVP5viGOHPBda4tug.text: Read the reviews and was prepared for the line. It did not live up to my expectations, although it was decent.  I had the white chocolate macadamia nut pancakes. They were dense and doughy, not fluffy at all. The server (BTW-the servers were all fantastic) said they had new kitchen staff. I will give this place another try soon, but right now I'm not super impressed.

RBwkE0QwhkMBduKM4MUNlA.text: Mother's Day and to go food don't mix. We were quoted 45 at 9:45am. We still haven't got our food. It's 11:23. I'm seeing an abundance of to go orders piled up behind the register. There's a fine line between greed and having your patrons whom  invested their valuable time to dine in. It's just the right thing to do to cut to go orders off and focus on the guest at hand. I love this place.. and the wait is great and the food is awesome... but just do the right thing. 11:30- got food.

4pfvJlkbLd-w0I-jC6qMjg.text: Just a real down home experience. Christopher is superb at waiting tables, great attitude, and really helpful. They didn't have the exact menu item I was looking for, so they improvised. How many places will do that for you? It was excellent. There are many items on their menu I would like to try, so this will be my go-to place for a while. Thanks Christopher.

rJSJDGXfVP4jnp5EAfYsLA.text: 1st visit very friendly staff...fast service. Food is another story...I had the chicken fried steak...small portion, dry and gravy was thin with no taste. Potatoes lacked taste. Friends food also lacked taste. I give the food two stars. I will give second chance because staff was on top of things...maybe just a bad day for the cook, will try again.

_uoLAr1-1k3SoNBt2xzgpQ.text: Place was crowded but the wait time wasn't too bad, maybe 10 minutes or so.  Tried the Red Velvet Pancakes which were really yummy.  Their Chicken Adobo fried rice omelette was delicious if you're more into the savory.  Would've liked to have tried everything else on the menu but will have to look forward to the next time we're in Vegas!!

rceAW6FgUEfVLjavr0nlmA.text: Friendly staff and great service . We regularly go to the one on Stephanie and I have to say the difference in quality of food makes the drive worth it . We had a large party , most of whom ordered a variety of different pancakes. All agreed they were fantastic ! We still highly recommend the red velvet as the staple best . I personally ordered lunch today and the BLT was great .

I8jHsVCtmf5UDUPyqC1tZQ.text: Haven't been let down yet. Only complaint is the wait, but I guess that's what happens when you're that good. Once you're seated it's fantastic. I recommend the go-to Red Velvet pancakes if you like sweet stuff.

vxDr2DMyr8GxRaiiU_Xvag.text: This is the best breakfast place you can go to. They're red velvet pancakes are to die for. Everyone is so friendly here. They're typically always busy but it's so worth the wait.

fn506jGbNRxOB_2oYLtdGw.text: Terrible food. I'm speechless! A friend was raving about this cafe, so based on her recommendation I gave it a try this morning for breakfast.  First off, I have been in hospitality for years and know what good high quality food is supposed to look and taste like.  Unfortunately this was some of the worst I've ever had. The corned beef hash was over salted and even when mixing some of the egg yolk in, was barely edible. I was excited to try their homemade Kalua pork which came highly recommended by a very nice server. Sadly, it was soupy and slimy with a faint smoke flavor added. The pancakes were the worst I've ever had and interestingly this cafe prides itself offering a vast variety of them. They were a tough and chewy inedible disaster. They looked nice and fluffy, however so much baking soda was added to give them their beautiful appearance, that it completely destroyed the flavor. I want to taste buttermilk or a hint of sweetness, not salty baking soda. And let's talk about the side of fruit, when I thought it could not get any worse. The fruit was old and obviously has been sitting in the fridge for days. Rubbery translucent cantaloupe and honeydew and old strawberry slices. I normally do not complain but I did end up speaking to the manager. Although dressed as server she, did agree with everything I said, confirmed the fruit was cut yesterday and has been refrigerated and also agreed with the horrible pancakes and Kalua pork. My meal was comped and she thanked me for bringing this to her attention. Amazingly the place was packed and based on the items I have tried I don't even want to imagine what the rest of the menu tastes and looks like.  If you need help to raise your food quality and standards, I've also been a restaurant consultant for years and would be happy to assist. Sadly, this was atrocious...

uoXKOWXnqr17UZxJek4YQA.text: good portion size, lots of pancake selection, friendly service. large lunch selection. open till 2:00pm.

xStaeetLYLXywrr4IAq4uA.text: The food was average to slightly above-average.  However, the service was out of this world.  Coffee was refilled before I could ask and numerous free gratuities were offered.  Highly recommend and I recommend also going before 930.

Pu-JrNorEQLMNfYn3Sl_fw.text: The atmosphere is pleasant and our server Joey was awesome. The only thing that made me want to give this place a 1 star review is the fact that this is the second time I have found HAIR in my food. I would think that they would not charge me for the food that had the hair in it as a courtesy, but both times I had this encounter they still charged me. They need to practice proper sanitation in the kitchen, because this is NOT how customers should feel leaving an establishment of this nature. I am secretly disgusted and would not be coming back here anymore.

t4MkbjI5watvdBG41XU1AA.text: Adobo fried rice & red velvet pancakes never fail! Delicious. And server Jason was very nice.

MktNE-krf14wyC5tah9-uw.text: Nice lil' place near me. Staff is nice, and the food is pretty good. Few times ive decided to take my food to go because the seating was bad. Over all service, and food is a high 4 to me.

wYkDmXv1dWXFyRcZ6gKe-Q.text: Good food at good prices, this is like a mom and pop dinner. They have over 22 kinds of pancakes, awesome skillets and omelettes. I would definitely go back.

IH0GXdoRYfkRMDBJTRyyBw.text: Bananas foster pancakes is to die for! Walked in at 7 and it was so busy. Had one waiter and he did a great job!! Food is fresh and great quality. Best place to get breakfast!!

lDghBzuAe8w3Z9pa-SzMqw.text: Red velvet pancakes are really good. Not too sweet, fluffy like pancakes should be. My parents got spam and eggs with garlic rice. They liked it. The adobe fried rice looked tempting too. Good menu selections. Service is fast. Came here on a weekday and there was no crowd.

iy4kbOvZazOS3J-D79RRRg.text: I was here today for the first time, very cute place a little small but that's ok, the food was really good, food Came out very quickly, reasonably priced.  We will def be returning.

FbpIRnk4uibOx5f7uzshZw.text: Food is good, service is good most of the time except for one guy, will need to get his name. The main things we don't like is the place is small and you are sitting so close to everybody/other tables. Also very loud but probably due to putting so many people in a small place and no barrier to speak of from the kitchen area.

hnzEdcpuMjIuxpmlfoelsQ.text: Great! 3rd time. First at this location. Service was wonderful. Cowboy omelet delicious. Red velvet pancake. Dessert!! These places are great!!!!

_1Njn48Vyed1VhtRXST8jQ.text: This place is not too bad and the wait was pretty light. It is so hard to find a decent place to eat breakfast at on a Saturday or Sunday that does not either cost an arm and a leg, or does not have a hour plus wait. We have been to many. Babystacks is a good place to eat without much of a wait. Their prices are pretty reasonable considering you are getting a much more reasonable proportion of food. A lot of the breakfast places in the area have MASSIVE (like plate sized pancakes), baby stacks serves small and more reasonable pancakes that are equally good and much less money. This was the first time we can here and it was good, so was the service. My kids enjoyed their chocolate chip pancakes, and my wife (who isn't a huge breakfast fan (crazy I know!)) got their grilled cheese. I had their pancake breakfast with eggs, hasbrowns and sausage. All of it was good, manageable proportions, and came out quickly. I highly recommend a visit here. We will be back.

H7xBI7ytvACi6iLCGEzgZA.text: What a great edition to the mountains edge area.  The food was great, the atmosphere was fun and the service was fast.

lJwvYBZdt0ynLs8XPIedKw.text: Omg. So good. I was afraid to try the red velvet pancakes because I thought it'd be too sweet but boy am I glad I did! It was absolutely perfect! I love how they gave the cream cheese syrup on the side so it's not drenched or covered completely with it like a red velvet cupcake! I thought the service was amazing, our coffee was refilled quickly and they were super nice and accommodating to us even when we had 2 toddler boys with us. We also had the cowboy omelette and it came with the perfect amount of ingredients- the ham, green peppers and onions and even the cheese- it was perfectly balanced. We also loved the blueberry pancakes and my 4 year old loved the banana ones. I definitely cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the red velvet!!!

4uMGJQgO4OQ_h3zDI_Wkyw.text: Love their food. The only complaint I have is trying to order food for pickup. Every time I've tried to order over the phone on Sunday, I get a busy signal. I've literally called from outside and no one is on the phone. It looks like they leave it off the hook.

MosrX5p5iZ9t1PEgplVVMw.text: After a 30 minute wait . The service was good. Food was very good as well. Did my special order with no negative comments. Food was fresh and very tasty. My only negative comment us they need a bigger restaurant! I noticed while I was waiting lots if people left cause of the wait time.Heard a few people say its too crowded once you get seated too. This wa the location on Blue Diamond not sure if Or her ones.

4DhY7V3Fw8WlDAwx2XsY7A.text: I really enjoyed the Chili Moco and my lemon pancakes.  What is great is it is so different than most breakfast places.  If you are in the mood for something unique this place is it.  Love the Gigantic water glasses, service was awesome and Filipino Friendly...I tried their house special breakfast which is Adobo Rice wrapped in egg...looks like a burrito made of egg....It had very good flavor.  I will definitely go back.

JOgqtBfUjGgPa1OkiEPyDA.text: I had the local favorite. Rock's chicken adobo omelet. It was great, but I think to make it even more tastier and awesome if adobo sauce drizzled on top of it. Or have an option to order side aviso sauce.

Uas_56uJzDWqKjQV57c8_A.text: We were seated right away, service was fast, and friendly.  I do not eat panckaes eggs, and haven't for YEARS, not only my did I eat them but I loved them! I had the chicken omlet, and the Lemon Ricotta pancakes. The fresh lemon and cream cheese icing made it! I told my husband, we will be back because there are a few more pankcakes i want to try. He was happy with his plate too, the Loco Moco.  You may have made me a pancake eater! Way to go.

PsNZq9EtFoIQVb6E0WhFYA.text: We have eaten breakfast here twice and have thoroughly enjoyed both visits.  One time was without kids and one time was with kids, and both times had great food.  The pancake menu is so extensive and unique, the coffee is good, and the eggs are always cooked to perfection.  My husband has asked for the oatmeal on both visits and both times was told it wasn't available, so that was a bummer.  But, you don't go to a pancake place to eat oatmeal, anyway.  The wait can get long so the earlier the better.  They do not split checks for group dining so be prepared to have everyone pay cash.

IMx4SD4MdpdNHzoMJTs9Iw.text: Amazing as always. Eggs- perfect. Bacon- perfect. Pancakes with fresh strawberries, house made whipped cream and house made strawberry syrup- AMAZING!! Service was great as well. My favorite breakfast spot!

03zbz3_27nMMFM0Tjcp5og.text: We just found our breakfast place.   So close to home.   Asian Pacific food from adobo, Spam and corned beef.  I'll add more next time when I try the rest.

baxtdn0HqebJMrH6RuerNg.text: Small place    long wait   food is pretty good  got the loco mock with garlic rice    rice was simply perfection   burger pattie was paper thin and salty   eggs done well   this is the newer location  very popular

p7WkSFnnSROn_tIIm_GH5w.text: I love Babystacks and have gone to many of their locations for a few years now but I will not be going back to this location. They were full on a Sunday, as usual and service was beyond slow and lacking. There were so many employees "working" yet nothing seemed to be getting done. With tables in close proximity you can hear EVERYTHING, even every mistake and forgotten item by the server from the guests. There were multiple bussers standing around watching the football game while there were dirty tables everywhere with guests waiting to be sat and when they did start cleaning tables took forever to clean and would drop things on the floor without picking it up, had inappropriate conversations with each other while using foul language right in earshot of guests, servers on their cell phones behind the counter, drinks unfilled... or no drinks all together, 3 hosts standing around chit chatting with each other.   I am a restaurant manager and see past most things and even give excuses but on this occasion, I cannot. If I were the owner, I'd want to know! Gave me anxiety just being there for 45 mins. With this location being so close to home and being so new, it's a shame. I will make the extra 20-25 minute drive to go to their other location or to another breakfast spot.

9gvQeoJ78mihEYCo2ffkBg.text: Not bad here. Service was good, Edgar was pretty on point with everything. The hash browns were terrible my mom said. I liked the strawberry pancakes though. Not sure I'd come back, nothing impressed me enough to really make it desirable to come back. I remember the location up north being really good, not sure this location compares. And if you guys are reading this....please clean and dust the lights above the bar area, they look nasty.

3YjH8fn4NW08wAucg0cWjg.text: Babystacks is known for great food and their Blue Diamond location is no different. They regularly have specialty pancakes that are off-menu (just ask) that you can order if you eat in or order for take out.

2uKMb5yr1Qr1pkTSA0gutg.text: Hands down a great place to eat...enjoyed each bite till the very last one...seating a little crowded but with food this good that didn't matter to much...will be back!

hzWfAcnjPa3lS9VR43yjlA.text: Really good breakfast, haven't tried their lunch yet but the omelettes and skillets are really good and reasonably priced.

b12KymognmzDxaUkE7Z_qg.text: This place was so delicious. Where else could i have ordered garlic rice and carrot cake pancakes ? Everyone in my party enjoyed their meals and their themed pancakes. Deffinitely best bang for your buck.

NWJlT6SkqM8H0uOuXAvpwA.text: Had the Carrot Cake short stack and a strawberry lemonade. Both were pretty good. Service was ok as well. Wasn't overly busy. I arrive around 8 in the morning. I'd return whenever I return to Vegas

mYEYW003uR6XIuZl4iDsMQ.text: Just finished breakfast here and I see a Yelp sticker on the door so I downloaded the app. The staff is welcoming, it seems they enjoy their job. The art work is really nice at this location also. Will be back soon!

C9v4-udPQ_T3HrdBbq6oqA.text: Yummy food! The waitress not so friendly like she was in a hurry to take our order. Other than that the food is delicious

fagWMQbmRf5Jt9bMT9Pk7w.text: This is an off the strip gem. My friend took me here for brunch after picking me up from the airport which was smart because I was starving. This place cured the hunger pains and got me ready to welcome on a fun Vegas weekend.   The menu is large, I mean front and back large with tiny writing to fit all the options they serve. The menu covers everything sweet and savory to satisfy all palettes. The pancake selection is massive and imaginative but I had to take a stab at the Filipino options. Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice....umm yes please. Adobo marinated chicken served in the shape of a burrito covered by a delicate blanket of omelet style egg. It was a quiet brunch because I was busy stuffing my face, which I think is a compliment. Meanwhile, stacks and stacks of fun colored pancakes topped with fluffy whipped cream were being served to neighboring tables and you could see the eyes of kids light up. The service was on point too. Our waiter was friendly and checked on us consistently which definitely enhanced our brunching experience. Overall it was a delicious experience and my tummy was happy with me. Definitely seems like the kind of place that belongs in the Bay Area too!

FQDXGO5t9ZtmLrlxZYe75Q.text: Love this place! Great, friendly service all the way around. Including host cashier and servers! Food is always delicious. Banana fosters pancakes are the best!!!

UnL3e4S6y7292Uy7q7N6CQ.text: Trip to Vegas with cousins and wanted to stay away from the strip tourist areas. This place is located near where we were staying so decided to give it a try based on suggestions. We really enjoyed it. We ordered Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice with a side of Red Velvet Pancakes.

RiO5S3lZVs_hwB3APo9bMg.text: Trying this place for the second time and came to the conclusion that the food isn't good. Both times the pancakes taste like baking soda. The adobo fried rice omelet didn't have any taste of adobo, the shredded chicken was in big clumps, and there wasn't much rice. (If you want good Adobo fried rice omelet go to Aloha Kitchen) The breakfast burrito was plated on a tiny plate that made you feel like you had no room to eat or it'll fall off the plate. The cheese wasn't fully melted and was rubbery. The service was good.  The server was nice and hospitable but other than that I wouldn't go back.

pr2HcPNOJLTfgBr2aqYQFQ.text: Been hearing of this place for awhile now for the "Local style" menu selections like back home - HAWAII  We arrived close to lunchtime because i seen they had a late menu for breakfast on Sunday morning and they were pretty busy. For my little and myself we were sat right away.   I already had an idea of what i wanted to order but still wanted to look over the menu. So many decisions.....Red Velvet pancakes, Kalua benedict, Loco Moco, etc.    Mmmmmmm. So ono! I opted for the BYO omelette (3 eggs, choice of 2 veggies, 1 meat and 1 cheese) thats alot of choices, i see alot of places will only give you 2 choices with 2 eggs where this place is 4 and 3 eggs!!!!! Score! It also came with potatoes and choice of toast or pancakes. I asked to swap my side to white rice of course and got the pancakes for her to eat instead of toast. Asked for Aloha Shoyu which they did have NO TO KIKKOMAN!!! Hahahahaha.  Food was awesome Service was great and the local atmosphere was great. Local music playing throughout restaurant. Give this place a try! You will be pleased!

GEGrDGkIPnDuHtZPwsmyhw.text: Very poor customer service/organization... I arrived at 1pm on Saturday February 23, 2019... walked in and waited for the cashier to be done with her customer... when she was done I told her I needed a table for 2 and she said okay one moment... she kept on helping the customer check out then the hostess appeared, did not approach me but took someone who just walked in the door behind me right to a table without even acknowledging I was standing right there first and waiting... after I brought it to her attention I was waiting she said oh okay it'll be 2 minutes... I just thought it was rude that they had no organization there and the hostess and the cashier do not communicate to make it more organized... that upset me and I ended up leaving because of the rudeness...

djPWfFW2_T9-v2TiTFtNDA.text: I was recommended to come here by a previous local. Loved that I listened to her! Babystacks has a huge menu with tons of pancake flavors and Filipino/Hawaiian/island inspired dishes.  During this visit we tried the red velvet pancakes, the corned beef and garlic rice, and the Portuguese sausage and garlic rice.  Everything was delicious! I could've eaten a whole bowl of the whipped cream that came on the pancakes! I only wish the portions were a bit bigger on the non-pancake items.  I will definitely come back and try something else, maybe the loco moco and the lemon ricotta pancakes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

50AQXO1gfVJN_OMltLcxvw.text: Had a great experience at Babystacks. The venue is small and the tables are close to each other.  Be prepared to wait a little if you go on a weekend. I had Rick's Adobo Fried Rice made with egg whites and cinnamon roll baby stack. They were both phenomenal! No doubt they were some of the best pancakes I ever had. The server was very nice and checked on us regularly. I'll definitely be going there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J594YZ7uhpn-DC17zZkuAg.text: Wife and I came in here on Monday 2-11 for breakfast. Service was excellent and the food was really good. Staff is friendly and was very attentive when it came to us and if we needed anything. Great place to get a good home cooked meal. 5 stars

rLEZB36M3k7IWvkRmTVNfw.text: I went here today for breakfast for the first time. It was a weekday so no wait. I am so glad I finally went. Cute little cafe. Open breakfast and lunch. Breakfast was so good. Well priced for the food and great service. I went basic-scrambled eggs, bacon, diced potatoes and pancakes instead of toast. They have a menu with all sorts of great breakfasts and many things to try. They have a selection of different pancakes of which all looked terrific. Looking forward to return there soon.

fnkd5azJfTjdRh6tW1ZlZA.text: I absolutely love this place. They have two locations one on Stephanie and another one Blue Diamond. Both locations are small and always packed. But packed for a reason, they have a variety of dishes all good for breakfast and lunch.  I tried to keep it simple and I ordered the Kaula Pork grilled sandwich, instead of ordering French fries like usual, I upgraded my side to a babystack of pancakes. I settled for Ricky Road, and I was super glad. The pancakes were rich and full of goodies- marshmallows, Chocolate syrup, almond slivers and whip cream.  I almost was able to finish one stack until my son ate the rest, my lil Chocolate monster stole my stack.  But it was okay the Sourdough grilled sandwich filled with kaula Pork was good and fulfilling.  I left the table full and content. My husband ordered the Portuguese omelette and love it, he was torn on ordering the Kalbi short ribs- but the waiter suggested the omelette and my husband enjoyed his omelette and was very full. His omelette almost looked like a burrito filled with sausage and veggies.   My son ordered the quesadilla and he was a happy camper, he wasn't a fan of the fries, because they were topped with seasoning salt, so his fries were red and not the usual color. Maybe not a big deal to most, but for picky eaters it is.  Was I mad? Nope- more fries for me while he ate my pancakes:/ So overall the restaurant usually has a wait, and the locations are small. So seating can cause the lines of waiting long.  Is it worth the wait? Yes- Yes it is. Is the food good? Yes-Yes it is Would I come back again- Yes- Yes I would.....

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SourDough Grilled Cheese kaula Pork sandwich
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese Sausage Omelette
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Quesadilla and fries

EeygmDLi3FZ0xiLL--BOJw.text: Great place for breakfast. The food is really good. Our server Joaquin was excellent!

M8jyBByi1vKYxTN9qi2EaQ.text: Devoured the food too quickly, otherwise there would have been pictures..  There's not enough good things to say how great this place is. Friendly service and a familiar, yet unique menu.   I got Chili Loco Moco w/ garlic rice and wow. I would've never thought to put two of my favorite things together, but what a match made in heaven. The chili is meaty, the rice garlicky, and the eggs runny. It's great loco moco that is elevated by chili and cheese. I got it with a side of their homemade mac salad and that was also amazing. It wasn't over the top heavy on the sauce and was a cool contrast to the chili.   However, my partner probably got the star dish. The chicken adobo fried rice omelette with hash browns. W-o-w. Great flavor and the egg "wrap" really added a silky texture against the rice and chicken.   Both dishes are very flavorful and a unique take on simple breakfast items. The price is very reasonable and the portions are huge. Definitely have to come back to try their pancakes, they looked amazing but I was lured by the chili loco moco. No regrets, just have to have a return visit. 10/10 would recommend. Service, food, everything is on point here.

JmJhOnZBJqQemWzts56Z6g.text: Definitely a place you need to visit. Great service. I recommend the specialty pancakes!

XgusWSftyagAsGpNSHswxA.text: Their pancakes really are delicious, especially the red velvet with cream cheese frosting. Soft, warm, fluffy pancakes with frosting that's not too sweet with a nice slight tart to it. I always get the corned beef hash, brother gets the spinach benedict and we split an order of red velvet pancakes to get the best of both worlds. Entrees come with a side of regular pancakes that you can substitute with a specialty pancake for an extra charge. That's typically the way to go if you want to try a little bit of everything on the menu without placing a full order of a stack of pancakes (too much for one person).

cPk4l7czfZEU1s5Gt00Piw.text: This is definitely a try if you haven't visited Babystacks Cafe yet. Go for breakfast. Especially on your day off because you'll want the feeling of not having to go into work after eating the Orange Creamsicle pancakes.  I also tried the Loco Moco off of a fellow family member's plate and that was very tasty. Considering the Loco Moco isn't my favorite plate lunch, theirs is delicious. I usually go before 8am which there is hardly a wait and the service is amicable. Just like the Terminator, "I'll Be Back."

c1QjLkakn5N-IaUhwPVQfQ.text: This is my favorite Filipino or hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas. Their pancakes are so unique and delicious without being to overwhelmingly rich and sweet. My favorite dish is their fried rice with pork with over medium eggs, and their lemon ricotta pancakes. I'm hoping that this place will eventually partner with ubereats or postmastes so I can order from home!

9G_7TjhGpZKl8njHI5CpxA.text: The food is great and these banana cream and strawberry pancakes are to die for. Prices is very very reasonable and service is terrific.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_gkR46_grsMFHJp-8nR24Q.text: Wait wasn't too bad. Greeted well.   My wife ordered the Loco Moco with Garlic rice. (she shared and it was SUPER tasty)  i got the adobo fried rice omelette. first time trying it as chicken adobo, i usually get pork adobo. It was okay, will be sticking with the pork adobo fried rice omelette. next time i will try the eggs benedict. but GOTTA have the garlic rice. haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco wth garlic rice. YUM
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette

ee3x9kf1EJ8W7xkwNHOJ_w.text: After a night out on the town, I came to visit my brother and nurse a hangover with some good food. He suggested we come to Babystacks Cafe - foodie adventures run in my family genes. After a bit of a wait (the place was packed), we were seated.   Everything on the surrounding tables looked and smelled amazing. I wanted to order one of each! But with a queasy stomach from too many drinks, I settled on something simple so as not to upset my equilibrium. I got the bacon and eggs breakfast which came with three strips of bacon, eggs any style, potatoes or hash browns, and two pancakes. Although simple, it was absolutely delicious. The breakfast potatoes were so tasty. And I upgraded my pancakes to try their infamous Red Velvet pancakes. SO GOOD.   So if you're looking for a great breakfast/lunch spot off The Strip, come to Babystacks Cafe.

x0sZdnL3c8N9GaPwqV9TKQ.text: Came here with a few of my friends and the boyfriend on a very hot Las Vegas morning.  It was a Friday and it was packed!  We waited for a good amount of time but nothing too long.  The hostess seemed a little overwhelmed since he was trying to man the cash register, seat people and get the to go orders all at the same time.  Any case, he got through his list of things to do and we were seated in no time.  The menu is a little overwhelming.  There were so many options to choose from - from adobo fried rice to Portuguese sausage to the variety of pancakes and to sandwiches.  Again, it was overwhelming to choose what to eat!  In any case, we placed our ordered and waited for a good 10 minutes or so and we had our breakfast.  The boyfriend ordered the cookies and cream short stack.  It came with three pancakes and a huge dollop of fresh whipped cream.  As well as a side of cream cheese syrup.  He was in heaven.  He loved every bite of it.  I had a piece and it was just way toooooo sweet for me, but like I stated, it was perfect for the boyfriend.  I ordered Lolo Rick's adobo fried rice.  It was wrapped up in an omelette and I had a side of hash browns.  It was carbs on carbs.  The fried rice was a little too dry for me.  A part of me should have asked (if it was offered and doable) if I could get the eggs over easy.  The omelette was cooked a little too well done and if it was a little runny, it would have been great with the rice.  I love runny yolk with rice.  Overall, the flavor was great, it was a little too dry for my preference.  The other items that my friends ordered looked great and everyone loved their meal.  After it was all said and done, our bill came out to less than $70, which was great considering we ordered A LOT of food.    Overall, the staff was attentive enough, the food was okay, there are so many options on the menu and the price point is decent.  Would I come back?  Why not.  I would like to try the other options they offer and they sure have on their menu a lot to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Missing one plate. But it&#39;s what everyone ordered.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies &amp; cream pancakes.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lolo Rick&#39;s adobo fried rice with a side of hash browns.

6jzQZFr83ZQblc54yK36Uw.text: This place is awesome. Great food. Great service. My friend and I had never been there and stopped in right at closing on a whim, and the staff was great. They made us feel right at home, and then they gave us great food. We tried a couple different things, and they were all great. Awesome mash up if Hawaiian/Philipino and country style breakfast foods. Also, an incredible line up of pancakes.. Like whaaaaaaaa!! We got seasonal pumpkin pancakes that were like little fluffy pumpkin pie slices, topped with their housemade whipped cream   Also got a kalua pork grilled cheese sandwich on sourdough that was killer.  Great food. Great service. I'll be back for sure

2oLZTWV9UVcq6mGu4E2vqw.text: Who doesn't love Babystacks, honestly?! Every single time I come here, I am never disappointed. My go to is the Cookie Butter French Toast with a side of seasoned potatoes (because I'm always craving them.) The cookie butter is nice and smooth with a great crunchy texture, not too thick. Sometimes I wish they'd put a little more whipped cream on top hah! As you can tell, this obviously isn't the healthiest of breakfast choices.. Their pancakes are super fluffy and moist, definitely creative as well! The best thing about this spot is that it doesn't break the bank! Relatively cheap but good quality food, what's better than that??

9MBP-yTR9gN4Xwlh2r2grg.text: Babystacks is a great breakfast place with awesome pancake options and island influence. The service is good, the portions are filling, and the price is just right.  I recommend the Two-Egg Breakfast. It's great for the indecisive diner, who has trouble choosing between a sweet or savory breakfast. And for only $6.25, you can get both in the form of two eggs cooked any style, potatoes or rice, and a small stack of pancakes or toast. And as president of the hypothetical potato fan club, I'm definitely an advocate on behalf of these potatoes. These potatoes are well-seasoned, slightly crispy, but remain wonderfully fluffy in the center. And even though rice is life, that's my shit.   As for pancake recommendations, I definitely recommend the strawberry pancakes. While the other pancakes are delicious, I find them overwhelmingly sweet and tap out after a few bites. But I NEVER get sick of the strawberry pancakes. Not only are they a classic flavor combination, the syrup tastes fresh and feels like the perfect counterweight to the pancakes.  Overall, Babystacks is definitely one of my favorite breakfast diner options!

eqvgy13PwQty8Jkf9W-8dA.text: Loved this place. Try the German chocolate pancakes. After a month on Keto, I was visiting Vegas from TN to run into this gem. While I purposely didn't eat Keto, this place was awesome. Great pancakes, fast service. Stop in!

V9XCf2a6sL7hkaOVKkROhQ.text: This place was always at the top of my search results for breakfast but somehow I never made it over here until Sunday morning. We typically go to breakfast with the older crowd (7am)... so 10am was late for us and we knew there would be a wait anywhere we go. They told us 20 minutes for 2 people and we hung out outside until we were called. The dining area is tiny! but we were offered seats at the high top bar area within 15 minutes. The place was slammed but our server still managed to give great customer service. The coffee was really good! There was no flavored creamer (I didn't ask) but just half & half cups. I ordered a basic 2 egg breakfast & turkey sausage - not much to say- everything was good there. The star of the show was the cinnamon bun pecan pancakes. We ordered a short stack to split and I highly regret not ordered a tall stack! These were SO GOOD. The icing & pecans really topped it off. Definitely going to return and try the other many varieties of pancakes they offer!

NKUPKO0iR8aWGtzWCbGMUQ.text: Coming from someone who enjoys going to brunch every now and then, this place was aightttttt. The location is great from my home, literally down the street. Variety wise on the menu, they got it down. I was expecting a bit more because the hype was so built up. Now being able to experience it for myself, I was satisfied but not to the point where i wanted to finish my food.   I ordered the Piglet Skillet. If you want unseasoned over fried potatoes and barely any cheese and overdone scrambled eggs; I definitely recommend this dish. It was really dry, like something they just threw together on the grill without any seasonings.   My parents ordered the Senior breakfast both exactly the same except one with scrambled eggs and the other with over easy eggs. Our waiter failed to comprehend that. He thoughtfully replaces the eggs and let us keep the old eggs. Over all the food was okay, just wish it wasn't bland. Oh and mind you, we asked for condiments including salt and pepper and he failed to bring the salt and pepper.    Our waiter, he was nice at first. Greeted us once we sat down but after he brought us our order of drinks, it began going downhill from there. He checked up on us once throwout our whole 45 minutes there. I had to signal him down for him to come to our table. It's funny cause he would look our way but not make his way.   Would I go back here to eat again? Sure, if everything else was crowded I definitely would. Please season your potatoes at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DyBeS_7w2XZ-_GNMFjl3hA.text: Probably my favorite breakfast place in Vegas! I got lucky and this new location is right down the road from my house. It's smaller than the other location I usually visit but luckily I have visited on weekday mornings and not on the weekends. Since the location is small I would imagine if you came mid-morning or later on the weekends you would probably have to wait a while. For this reason I'd get there early if you go on the weekends.  Our service has always been good. The waiters are attentive and have good customer service skills.   They always have great pancakes and you can always add the speciality pancakes to any breakfast. This is what I always do so I can have the egg, sausage, etc breakfast with something yummy and sweet!  Today I decided to get the two egg breakfast with my eggs done over easy along with the potatoes with the tiramisu pancakes. I also decided to get a side of toast so I could dip it in my eggs. The tiramisu pancakes were the limited edition pancake so I had to try that. They were amazing! I recommend them if they are still on the menu when you visit. The eggs were also very good and I enjoyed them with my toast.  If you come here you MUST try the pancakes. You cannot go wrong with any of the different flavors they have although their red velvet is their best seller.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two egg breakfast with orange creamiscle pancakes

_xJcHWWK-yhYawWjqhjWHQ.text: Found this place on Yelp. This place was AWESOME!! Delicious food with EXCELLENT service. The price is very inexpensive as well. Cute, cozy restaurant. Will definitely return here when I visit Las Vegas again. I recommend the red velvet pancakes and the kalbi ribs. 5 stars!!!

XrwWpXSYiID0NKLOz2OLWw.text: Great local spot for breakfast food with an island flare

tpnimqkod-MvJ1HnmQQ_5A.text: One of my favorite breakfast places. Great variety of breakfast dishes. My favorites are the Kali beef, kalua pork grilled cheese and the cookie butter french toast. Babystacks has such unique flavors- everyone should try it at least once. It's really unforgettable. I've been here close about 5 times and the wait is never more than 10 mins. Staff is always very attentive and friendly. Danielle is my favorite server, she remembers me every time. I like that's it's always very clean as well. They never disappoint! Great place

JpwPx64OdcYf2dj4Pz5WtA.text: Not great  Not bad either. Pricey for what you get. I got mine to go, so of course it wasn't as great later.  The blueberry pancakes were wicked dry and no butter was provided in the to go box. But all in all, not bad.

ApG06gRVACtGh3lhNtBdoA.text: Good food, excellent service, and a variety of unique breakfast dishes make Babystacks one of my favorite hidden gems in Las Vegas. Try their scrambles with a side of pancakes!

OsPDXCUe05mSCb-WcHBlNg.text: The service was a little slow to start (and it wasn't that busy), but what we received once the food arrived made it worth it. The cookie butter French toast is incredible. I don't have a big sweet tooth, so I was hesitant when this showed up. All my fears subsided with the first bite. Not too sweet, perfectly paired with Nutella and whipped cream. Awesome option. Boyfriend had the loco moco, and he raved as well. We'll be back. One side note- we were interested in the adobo rice, and really wanted to try it without the omelette. Didn't see it as an option, but maybe we'll ask for a side order next time.

vTDKKwD8m6129kBIEJCz0Q.text: Came here with the family and it was a 30 minute wait luckily. We ordered Loco Moco, chili moco, chicken tenders, crepes, and red velvet pancakes. Food came out within 10 minutes. Yay!! Our server was excellent, she took care of us.

People came in, sat, ate and left. We were still outside waiting. She kept saying out table was almost ready. She kept seating smaller parties. We had 6 in our party but she never made space for us until we complained. Poor customer service from her part. The waiter was great and the food was good but I wouldn't go back.

BcU7mYFUKyorjUvxaAMs7w.text: If you have trouble with cold in any way, bring an extra layer. Their AC WORKS! Food is good and reasonable price point, been here about three times.   Asked server if they could season the steak and he looked confused. It became an 'issue.' , a small one, but still. They said they could put fajita seasoning on it which I said was fine. Never had a fuss before over wanting a steak sessoned.

hTjHxO9JQj0wRrgsMM_fqg.text: Visited Las Vegas for a convention and I wanted to get out of the strip to find a reasonable price for some good brunch. One of my friends suggested going to Babystacks Cafe since they are known for their pancakes and it's not too far from the strip.   As soon as I stepped in the restaurant, I felt like I was home in the Philippines. I had no idea that this was a Filipino based restaurant so I was truly excited when I saw the menu.   I've heard that pancakes is the way to go here, but I couldn't help and order Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice. Best omelette I've ever had. It was a big omelette so I had to take it to go. They had a lot of choices for pancakes but I had to order their Nutella pancakes.   If ever you're in Vegas and feel like having something other than the places offered at the strip, this is the place to go!
